pysar.image.writeGeoTiff¶

pysar.image.writeGeoTiff(z, filename, x=None, y=None, null=nan, coords=None, epsg=4326)[source]¶

Write binary data to a GeoTiff file

Parameters:

z : ndarray

Data array

filename : str

Name of output file

x : array-like

2-element list: (top-left x value, x spacing) or array of x positions [(0,1)]

y : array-like

2-element list: (top-left y value, y spacing) or array of y positions [(z.shape[0]-1,-1)]

null : scalar type(z)

Null or no-data value [None]

coords : str

Coordinate system (must be recognizable by GDAL) [None]

epsg : int

EPSG-defined coordinate system [4326]

Notes

  • Requires gdal for python
  • Only supports single-band outputs
  • If x or y are default or None, coords is set to None
